intro: Hieracium westii, commonly known as the western hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium westii is often found in regions with dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
